section.name: Use BeigeUML in a Maven project
section.p: The best way is use BeigeUML in a Maven project. If you do not prefer Maven see FAQ how to use beige-uml.jar to generate javadoc from command line.
Make following steps to do it:

ol.li: If you haven't Maven install it Download and Install Maven

Right now there is no BeigeUML Maven artifact in central Maven repository. Therefore you should download BeigeUML source (it required for Maven site skin "maven-bootstrap-skin" which source is also there), unpack and install it into local Maven repository. To install any Maven project open its folder (where is pom.xml) then execute from the command line "mvn install", result Maven artifact will be in the local Maven repository e.g. in "/home/.m2/repository/org/mycompany/myproj".

If your java project is non-Maven create simple Maven project from command line: mvn -B archetype:generate \ -DarchetypeGroupId=org.apache.maven.archetypes \ -DgroupId=com.mycompany.app \ -DartifactId=my-app Where replace group and artifact ID with yours once, then copy your java source into this newly created Maven project. Add these entries into pom.xml after "dependencies":
<reporting> <plugins> <plugin> <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId> <artifactId>maven-javadoc-plugin</artifactId> <version>2.10.3</version> <configuration> <doclet>org.beigesoft.uml.service.swing.CreatorDoclet</doclet> <docletArtifact> <groupId>org.beigesoft</groupId> <artifactId>beige-uml-swing</artifactId> <version>2.1.0</version> </docletArtifact> <useStandardDocletOptions>true</useStandardDocletOptions> </configuration> </plugin> </plugins> </reporting>
Install your Maven project from command line "mvn install", then create Maven site by run "mvn site:site". Maven site will be in folder "target", UML project will be in folder "src/uml". You can launch beigesoft-uml.jar and make some changes on diagram (see getting started), then recreate site again.
